blocks.description: This equation expresses the cosine of angle c in terms of sides a, b, and s.
This equation rearranges to find cosine of angle b.

blocks.text: Hence we shall work to find the supplement of b.

blocks.description: Logarithmic form of the cosine equation given for b.

blocks.text: It is rather easier to work in terms of the logs in preference to the logarithmic ratios. This means, however, that there is no single log available for it. It is in A = 90^{\circ}, the reading for log A will be 17904. If the logarithmic ratios are obtained.

blocks.latex: l = a \sin c = a \tan(90^{\circ}-b) = a \tan(90^{\circ}-18^{\circ}) = a \tan 72^{\circ}
blocks.description: This equation relates angle c with angle b and the sides.

blocks.text: Example 3: A point A, in latitude 50^{\circ} 7' 3''. A straight line is running which runs due E. at A. This straight line is prolonged for 900.
